post.descrizione: One hundred and forty four steps to discover the marvel of Villa Selvatico and to enjoy the view over the Euganean Hills area. The monumental staircase is the architectural element that best represents the historic home and the social ascent of the Selvatico family and was built by order of Benedetto Selvatico, under the supervision of the architect Tommaso Forzàn. Following a subsidence in 1646, the staircase was restored by the master builders in just one year. It is made up of 144 trachyte steps partly leaning against the hill and partly superimposed on a cryptoporticus that detaches from the rocky slope to develop on a pair of rampant vaults that cross the buildings of the nineteenth-century barchesse. The latest restoration works commissioned by the Miola family have enhanced the interior spaces below the staircase. The vaults and walls are embellished with a play of light that enhances the composition of the structures, highlighting the difference between the contemporary elements and the monumental historical ones.
